intro: Phyllanthus tequilensis, commonly known as the Mexican waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves that are often glossy and have a distinct veining pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found growing in moist, shaded environments. Phyllanthus tequilensis is also known for its potential medicinal properties and has been studied for its bioactive compounds.
